item.title: How one country has become a top destination for hair transplants
item.description: With more than 1 million people going to Turkey for the procedure every year, hair transplants are transforming men's scalps — and vanity. But not every story ends with a perfect hairline.

item.title: A bold doctor sent her kids away and helped beat one of the world's deadliest viruses
item.description: A year ago, Rwanda faced its first outbreak of Marburg virus. Dr. Tsion Firew remembers how scared she was — and how that didn't stop her from playing a key role in the remarkably effective response.

item.title: France's prime minister resigns after less than a month in office
item.description: Facing criticism from all sides, France's new prime minister Sébastien Lecornu resigned less than 24 hours after naming his government and after less than a month in office, plunging the country into a deep political crisis.
